description:
Despite the unbearable coldness of the Negev desert and the threatening humidity, I loaded the equipment with good blankets and my brave partner Einav.
And we went out to shoot in a wide field one of the beautiful objects "horse head and the fire nebula"
The horse head nebula is in the Orion constellation.The nebula is about 1,500 light-years away from the Earth.
The nebula is composed of clouds of dark dust and gases.
The red glow that is formed by hydrogen gas, at the base of the nebula, there are bright spots that are young stars in formation

Tech details:
light :20 x 600sec gain 139 offset 21
darks:20
bias :50
flat :50

Equipment:
Scope :William Optics GTF81 81mm Apo Refractor
Mount :NEQ6
Imaging camera: Asi071mc cool
Guiding camera: Zwo 120mm 
Guider: :Zwo 60mm
Other: QHY PoleMaster

Software:
Sequence Generator Pro, Stark Labs PHD 2.6, PixInsight 1.8,Lightroom cc

negev 12/2017
title: Horsehead Nebula and Flame Nebula
